Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: Porous COF layer with mesoporous structure, forming a core-shell composite

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion combined with specific affinity capture (guanidyl-phosphate interaction); small-sized peptides are trapped in the channel.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Various concentrations (0.02-20 fmol) and mixed with BSA digests at molar ratios up to 1:10,000 (phosphopeptide:BSA) for selectivity tests. Enrichment from human serum.
Other Information.Additional Info: Enriched from standard protein digests and human serum. Demonstrated excellent sensitivity (0.02 fmol) and high selectivity.

Guest Molecules.Molecule Name: Macromolecular proteins (e.g., Albumin from bovine serum (BSA))
Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion by COF pores; large-sized proteins are excluded.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Mixed with β-casein digests at molar ratios up to 10,000:1 (BSA:β-casein digests).
Other Information.Additional Info: Effectively removed/excluded by the composite material.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Specific affinity capture (interaction between guanidyl groups and the phospholipid bilayer of exosomes).

Other Information.Additional Info: Successfully captured and isolated from human serum, confirmed by TEM, NTA, and SDS-PAGE. Exosome concentration after isolation was 1.19 × 10^9 particles·mL−1.

Sieving Mechanism: Molecular sieving based on pore aperture size exclusion effect for smaller molecules (peptides) while excluding larger molecules (proteins).

Experimental Validation.Method: MALDI-TOF MS, SEM, TEM, XRD, EDX, FT-IR, Nanoparticle Tracking Analysis (NTA), Sodium Dodecyl Sulfate Polyacrylamide Gel Electrophoresis (SDS-PAGE).
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Size exclusion effect (β-casein digests:Albumin from bovine serum protein = 1:10,000 for selectivity). Loading capacity for phosphopeptides: 30 mg·g−1. Reusability: 10 cycles. Detection limit: 0.02 fmol for phosphopeptides.

Other Information.Additional Info: Magnetic guanidyl-functionalized covalent organic framework nanocomposite synthesized via layer-by-layer modification on a magnetic Fe3O4 core. The material forms spheres with a diameter of approximately 200 nm, featuring a uniform core-shell structure where Fe3O4 is encapsulated by COF, with AuNPs (approx. 15 nm diameter) embedded on the surface, and PEI-GF functionalization. The material synthesis does not conform to green chemistry principles.
